entry.title: soy wax melts and how to use them
entry.content:
At Antique Candle Co.Â®, our main focus isÂ candles. ğŸ•¯ Whether they are poured into classicÂ Mason JarsÂ or unique Antiques, much of our time is spent preparing beautiful candles to be sent right to your door.

However, we understand that amazing fragrance can come in MANY forms. Maybe it's because we spendÂ so much time in this space, but it seems like there is always something new to discover in the world of fragrance...

We dipped our toes in the water (so to speak!) to bring high quality, cozy smells into your home howeverÂ you want it! Which is why we're oh so in love with soy wax melts. â¤ï¸

Also sometimes referred to as "tarts,"Â you've probably seen these packaged in little plastic 'shells' in the department store or your favorite boutique. In fact, weÂ used to package them that way, too! However, we wanted to reimagine this amazing product to include MORE of your favorite fragrance, be totally mess-free, and easier to store! The newly redesigned look does just that.Â Soy Wax Melts are PERFECT for friends whoÂ love the benefit of having a flameless, smokeless scent! ğŸ¥°

Wax meltsÂ can fill a home withÂ your favoriteÂ fragrancesÂ just likeÂ aÂ candle! Both are made with our quality fragrance oil and naturalÂ soy wax. The only difference? How they are used.

Wax melts are not actually burned. They are melted using a fragrance warmerÂ specially made for wax. You can find these at just about anywhere that also carries melts, but we picked out a few of our favorites we think you'll love. ğŸ˜‰

DO NOT use a crockpot, coffee warmer, stove top, or anything thatÂ is not specifically made toÂ be used with waxÂ melts, andÂ read the packaging carefully to make sure you are using the right product!

Once you have a warmer, itâ€™s time to add the melts! ğŸ™Œ

Warmers typically have a ceramic or silicone dish on top of the heat source; this is where you put your melts.Â Do notÂ add water or anything besides the wax melts intoÂ yourÂ warmer.Â 

We recommend pouring 6-10 of our mini wax melt cubes onto yourÂ warmer dish to start. Adjust the amount depending on your warmer size or preference, but try not to overfill your warmer. You do not want the wax to overflow once it melts!

Next, just sit back, relax, and enjoy as the aroma fills the room! ğŸ˜‹

6-10 mini melt cubes can 'burn' for up to about 13Â HOURS.Â Thatâ€™s 13 hours of relaxation, warm thoughts, and a happy home!

When you're ready to remove old melts from your warmer, turn your warmer off. Use cotton balls to safely soak up the melted wax and wipe your warmer dish clean. Do not touch the hot, melted wax with your bare hands. If you are using a silicone "flip dish" with your warmer, turn the warmer off and allow the wax to cool completely before popping the wax out of the dish. Easy peasy!

If you were unsure about out soy wax melts, what they are, or how to use them, we hope this helped shed some light on how easy and effective melts can be. â¤

ï»¿ï»¿Shop Wax Melts

entry.title: how to clean your candle jars
entry.content:
At Antique Candle Co.Â®, we use Mason jars to house our yummy scented soy candles. ğŸ˜‹ Mason jars are also popular farmhouse dÃ©cor and craft pieces! Wouldnâ€™t it be nice to repurpose your old Antique Candle Co.Â® candle into something new and crafty?Â Â 

Two of the questions we often get is: How do you remove the printed label? How do you clean out the leftover wax from the jar? We've done the research for you and have found the bestÂ and easiest way to do just that!Â Â 

Hereâ€™s everythingÂ you'll need: ğŸ“
  • Citric Acid
  • Flour
  • Water
  • White Vinegar
  • Kitchen Spoon
  • Butter Knife
  • Dish Soap

Removing the Label

Our candle friendsÂ told us how much they would love to repurpose their candle jars and wanted to know how to remove theÂ label. We TOTALLY get it! We're always on the hunt for a good DIY & came up with two simple steps to remove the label.

Step 1: In a small bowl, dissolve 1 tablespoon of citric acid in 2 tablespoons of very hot water. Mix in just enough flour to create a thick paste. Apply to printed area and let sit for 10-20 minutes.Â 

Â 

Step 2: After the paste has set for a bit, scrape the paste off the glass surface. We used the end of our spoon! Ta-da! ğŸ˜

Â 

Removing the Wax

Once youâ€™ve removed the printed label, itâ€™s time to remove the remaining wax from the jar!Â 

Step 1: Place the candle in the freezer for several hours or until it is frozen. ğŸ§Š

Step 2: Remove from the freezer. While still frozen, use a butter knife (and a little bit of elbow grease ğŸ’ª) to loosen and break up the wax.Â Toss out any remaining residue (PRO TIP: get even more out your candle by adding the broken wax pieces toÂ your wax warmer ğŸ’–).Â 

Step 3: Once you've removed all the wax, next you'll need to pull out the wick. Our candles use a strong adhesive to keep your wicks centered in the jar, which means they need to soak! Fill your jar with HOT tap water (just enough to cover the wick). Let sit about 30-60 seconds for the adhesive to soften. Use your spoon to pull up the wick. ğŸ¥„

Step 4: Set your jar aside and pour about a half-inch of white vinegar in the bottom (just enough to cover the metal base of the wick). Let it soak for about an hour and that should loosen up the remainder of the adhesive! â°

Step 5: Once you have the remainder of the wick removed, you can then use a scrub brush and wash the inside of the jar. Not only will this help remove any remaining residue, but it will also clean away soot and stains on the glass from the candle itself! âœ¨

There you have it in a total of seven easy steps: how to clean your candle jars! ğŸ’ƒ

The possibilities are ENDLESS when it comes to repurposing your Antique Candle Co.Â® candles into something amazing! Check out some of our favorite DIYâ€™s below. ğŸ‘‡

Â 

Mason Jar DIYs

Â

entry.title: how to get the most out of your candle
entry.content:
Candles of any size, shape, orÂ scentÂ are beautiful additions to any home and can brighten an entire room, but they are also unique pieces of art that need to be cared for in order to get the most out of them.Â We at Antique CandleÂ Co.Â® have put together an easy-to-follow guide so that you may have the best possible experience with yourÂ candles.Â From ourÂ classic mason jarsÂ to ourÂ one-of-a-kind antiques...we've got you covered, friend!Â 

First Light

When you receive your new Antique Candle Co.Â® candle, let it burn long enough to allow the melted wax on the surface to reach the edge of the jar. This may take 2-4 hours depending on the size of your candle. Allow additional hours for those antiques that have a larger surface area.

After your first burn, we recommend burning your candle for no longer than 4 hours at a time for maximum quality and longevity. Once your candle has 1/4" of wax remaining, we recommend you switch to your next yummy candle! ğŸ’•

StorageÂ 

Candles like the dark! You may be familiar with this one: always store your candles in a cool, dry, and dark place. Storing candles in direct sunlight or harsh indoor lighting for long periods of time may cause them to fade or warp.Â  Even though all of our candles are white, this is still a good tip to follow!

Wicks, Wicks, Wicks

Trim them! This is a crucial part of candle care that, if not followed, can potentially be a hazard.Â Use an Antique Candle Co.Â® Wick TrimmerÂ to keep your wick about Â¼ - Â½ inch. This will allow for a more even burn and will help prevent the wick from mushrooming or creating soot.Â 

If the wick is not trimmed, the flame of the candle may grow too large and begin to smoke or flicker, which are signs that the flame isnâ€™t properly controlled.Â  If this occurs, simply extinguish the flame, wait for the candle to completely cool, and trim the wick with either a wick trimmer or scissors.Â 

Cleaning

If dust forms on the surface of your candle, be sure to clean it off before lighting. To do this, use a soft cloth that is either dry or lightly dampened with water.Â  You can also use a piece of nylon.

Snuff It Out

An Antique Candle Co.Â® Snuffer is recommended when extinguishing your candle. However, blowing out your candle works, too (justÂ be careful not to splatter the hot wax!)

Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â strives to bring a stylish and enjoyable candle experience to your home! But once the candle leaves us, it still needs to be handled with care.Â 

I hope that this short guide has helped you better understand how to care for your candle and has answered some of questions you may have had.Â  Follow these tips, and your candle will surely reach its full potential from start to finish!

Feelin' like a candle care PRO?! We hope so!Â  If you're looking for that "candle connoisseur" status, check outÂ even MORE tips and tricks on our blog!Â 

Have a blessed day!

Â 

PleaseÂ contact usÂ orÂ check out ourÂ Help DeskÂ if you have any questions or would like more information about Antique CandleÂ Co.Â® and ourÂ candles!

entry.title: how to date your ball jar
entry.content:
Â 

In 1880, the five Ball brothers used a $200 loan from their uncle to start a business manufacturing tin cans for products such as paint and kerosene. Then, in 1884, the brothers switched to glass home-canning jars and created the household name that we still know and love today. ğŸ¥°

Ball jars are classic vintage pieces that add so much class to every room! âœ¨ Not only are they beautiful as dÃ©cor, but they are genuine pieces of history that bringÂ so much life to a home. Each is unique in its own way!

Ball jars are one of the MOST sought-after vintage jar brands, which is why we created our Small Batch Candles. ğŸ’™Â Antiques are our obsession (it IS in our name, after all!). ğŸ˜‰Â We want to continue to repurpose beautiful, vintage, and completely one of a kind antique vessels, so we created a collection of these beauties to do just that. Many of the Ball jars available in the Small Batch CandlesÂ vary in their production dates. We even have some that are verified as 100+ years old! So, that begs the question:Â 

HOW DO YOU DATE YOUR BALL JAR?Â ğŸ§

Â 

To answer that, compare the logo of your jar to those on this chart: (from Minnetrista Gathering Place)

You can also use other identifying marksÂ to help date your jar! Phrases such as â€œIMPROVED,â€ â€œPERFECT,â€ and â€œIDEAL,â€ give further clues to find the approximate year that your Ball jar was made.

Some helpful notes to keep in mind:

  1. Not everyÂ jar has their manufacture date on the glass, but most have the patent date. However, this date has no relation to the year your jar was made.
  2. There will be a large number on the bottom of your jar. This is the mold number, and unfortunately also has no relation to the manufacture date.
  3. These charts tell you theÂ approximateÂ decade in which your Ball jar was made.
  4. EVERY Ball jar is special, and no matter what decade yours was manufactured, itâ€™ll still look beautiful in your home! ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

Â 

Shop our Small Batch Candles to snag your vintage Ball Jar - these beauties are actual, REAL repurposed antiques. Each one is hand-poured with love and made-to-order to YOUR specifications! ğŸ’™

Â 

SMALL BATCHÂ CANDLES

entry.title: how to style your vintage jars
entry.content:
Have you snagged a candle from our Small Batch Collection?

Nothing says "farmhouse" like a true vintage Ball jar filled with an extra cozy, hand poured soy candle. You just can't go wrong with a candle that looks as good as it smells! ğŸ˜Â Â 

Â 

Looking for thatÂ PERFECT spot toÂ brighten up your home?? Bestie...we got you covered! ğŸ¤— We recently asked ourÂ Antique Candle Co.Â®Â Photography Manager, Keliann, to share some of her best tipsÂ when styling old,Â Â Vintage Ball Jar Candles.:

"Vintage Ball Jars give that true vintage touch that every home needs. They pair really well with both modern and other antique pieces, which makes them perfect for literally any styled setting. The sky's the limit with these little blues!Â ğŸ’™"

Â 

As a photographer, what is your rule-of-thumb for creating gorgeous settings?

When I am styling any setting, I always make sure to include lots of different textures and colors! This is a key element in creating a setting that is interesting to look at. There are seriously soooo many fun ways to incorporate different textures and colors into ANY styled setting. ğŸ™Œ I love mixing soft towels with pops of color (looking at you, Old Vintage Blue Ball Jars ğŸ‘€ğŸ’™) and then incorporating more neutral, wooden accent pieces.

The extra attention to detail is really what takes styled pieces to the next level!

What are you trying to capture in a styled setting?

My goal in every setting is to make it feel intentional--I want everything to have a purpose of it's own! ğŸ’• When working withÂ a styled setting (especially in a home) the little details can get a bit overwhelming. I think that's why it is SO important to be extra aware ofÂ whyÂ I am placing a prop in the setting.

Fill in the blank. My biggest suggestion for anyone learning how to create a styled setting of their own is...

...toÂ stop for a minute and ask yourself 'Why do I love this piece?'Â andÂ 'How can I showcase what I love most about this piece?'Â 

Ask those questions, and you will only include the pieces you REALLYÂ love and that add value. The end result? A GORGEOUS set upÂ that makes you smile every time you look at it. âœ¨

How do you think styling Vintage Ball jars is different than Mason jars?

The Old Vintage Blue Ball jars are seriously one of my FAVORITE things to style because they actually do most of the work for you! ğŸ’ƒ They're seriously so stunning with as little or as much styling as you choose to incorporate.

Plus, there's just something about the color of the jar that makes it complimentary toÂ any set upÂ you create.

How did you create the styled setting in this photo?

Step one: Choose the Vintage Blue Ball Jar of your dreams! ğŸ’™âœ¨ My personal fave is the Old Vintage Blue Jar CandleÂ because I love knowing that I am working with a true antique that is 100+ years old! ğŸ™Œ

Step two: Find a blank canvas. I like to start in a space that doesn't have much going on, that way I can put things exactly where I want them!

Step three: Make it practical! This particular set-up was done in a kitchen so I wanted to make sure that it was both beautifulÂ andÂ functional. To do this, I put some staple ingredients (like oats and flour) into cute glass jars andÂ voila--they become part of the setting! âœ¨

Step four: Add some antique flare. It's probably not much of a surprise that most of us here at Antique Candle Co.Â® are biiiiig antique lovers (okay, maybe not a surprise at all ğŸ˜‚). Adding a few of your favorite antique accents is a great way to add ALL of the farmhouse feels to your setting.

Step five: Layer those details, bestie! ğŸ’ƒ Don't be afraid to add some little layered details like strings of beads or stacks of bowls. It's a great way to bring depth and interest to the entire set up.

Step six: Add some sweet florals or bright greenery to bring your setting to life. ğŸ’ğŸŒ¿ Because, let's be honest, flowers areÂ alwaysÂ a good idea. ğŸ™Œ

Step seven: Light those candles (and cue all the cozy vibes!). ğŸ•¯âœ¨ This is one of my favorite parts. It instantly makes the space feelÂ magical. ğŸ˜

Â 

Step eight: Snap a few pictures, sit back with a cup of coffee, and enjoy your new view.Â ğŸ˜Œâ˜•ï¸

How will you style your Vintage Jars?

After you snap aÂ photo, be sure to tag us on Instagram @antiquecandleco_. Â We wanna see ALL thoseÂ beautiful details, friend! ğŸ˜

Â SHOP BALL JARS

Â 

Â 

Â

entry.title: how to create the perfect candle setting: My Little Kate Cod
entry.content:
The girls at the Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â (previously Antique Candle Works) studio canâ€™t get enough of home dÃ©cor and the unique styles we see through some of our friends on Instagram.Â 

Our favorite look involves mixing the new with the old, the modern with the vintage.Â  I connected with our friend Katie fromÂ My Little Kate CodÂ to discuss her love for cape cod/farmhouse style dÃ©corÂ andÂ how to use Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â candles to create the perfect candle setting!

Though Katie doesnâ€™t have a professional interior design background, she has earned the title of â€œpretty space makerâ€ through years of growing up watching and working with her own mother as she decorated her home in stunning seasonal settings.Â  This is where she first witnessed mixing modern and vintage style!

When it comes to decorating, Katie always tries to worksÂ withÂ the house and all its unique characteristics.Â  She loves making every color, detail, and accent come together in perfect harmony in her old cape-cod house.Â 

With an old house comes many individual traits unique to that house, and working with those quirks allows Katie to truly bring the home to life.Â  This is evident by her gorgeous Instagram photos that I cannot get enough of!

One of my favorite things about her home is now naturally she fits in our candles into her dÃ©cor.Â  She makes a point for her candle placement to be safe, but also strategic.Â  She makes them centerpieces so that everyone who comes in and enjoys her lovely home can also enjoy her yummy candles!Â 

She also loves the warm glow that a candle brings to a room, which offers both light and ambience to her darker rooms with fewer lights.Â  What could be more cozy than soft candlelight?

When putting her candles out, Katieâ€™s favorite way to make a setting is actually to group candles together!Â  She likes havingÂ two candles, side-by-side, with one larger and one smaller.Â 

She says, â€œTogether they're like little pals that are working to make the space smell irresistible!â€Â  Even when the candles are not lit, thanks to Katieâ€™s design skills, they work right into her gorgeous home with their vintage look and neutral colors!Â 

Not only does pairing candles together create an adorable candle setting, but Katie puts together different scents that complement each other for a whole new candle experience.Â  She pairs her â€œfavoriteÂ favorite,â€Â Fresh Cut Herbs, with her second favorite,Â Sweet Lemon, that together are just â€œspring harmony!â€

Katie is a genius at creating the most perfect candle settings for her home, and I hope sheâ€™s inspired you to get creative with your candles, too!Â  Check out more pictures of her gorgeous home onÂ InstagramÂ for endless dÃ©cor inspiration!

Also see our other friendsÂ withÂ Perfect Candle Setting ideas likeÂ MarthaÂ for more tips and tricks to create your own adorable placements!

Â 

Have a beautiful day!

Â 

Â 

Â 

ï»¿Photography byÂ Katie Walsh

entry.title: how to style antique candles: The Turquoise Home + Our Humble Nest
entry.content:
The Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â teamÂ (previously Antique Candle Works)Â always has so much fun putting together vintage vessels for the monthlyÂ Antique Candle Sale, and we had many unique candles in our latest restock that we were so excited to share with you!

If you were lucky enough to snag one of these vintage pieces before they ran out, youâ€™ll need to know how to style them in your home!Â  Thanks to Laura fromÂ The Turquoise HomeÂ and Erica fromÂ Our Humble Nest, weâ€™ve put together some helpful tips and ideas for styling one of our antique candles in your home!

If thereâ€™s anything that makes these candles truly unique, besides their enticing scents, itâ€™s that they really are vintage.Â  We actually get these vessels from antique stores and similar sources to repurpose them into the adorable candles you see.Â  So, work with that!Â  Surround your candles with other vintage dÃ©cor pieces that complement the candles and make them the highlight of a room.

Speaking of making the candle a highlight of a room, putting it at a high place in an area may not make it the center of attention but will add an extra touch of eye-catching vintage style to your home.Â  Laura often places her antique candles on her mantel piece.Â  The light of a candle being at a high place warms up a room with happy moods and yummy smells.

Add it to a collection.Â  A collection of dÃ©cor, that is!Â  You might, like many of our friends with an interest in interior design, decorate their home based on seasons.Â  Luckily, our antique candles make perfect additions to every type of seasonal dÃ©cor.Â 

For spring, our blue Ball jars go particularly well will bright spring flowers and notes of greenery.Â  Pair them with these pieces to create stunning floral settings with the perfect note of vintage!

Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â candles are the only candles that Laura fromÂ The Turquoise HomeÂ burns in her house, and our antique candles in particular go perfect with her unique and bright style!Â  Erica fromÂ Our Humble NestÂ has many gorgeous photos of antique candles in her home by mixing the perfect amounts of green notes with her white/neutral colors.

No matter how you style your antique candles, there is no doubt that they will be the great additions to every room of your home!

Donâ€™t have one of these unique candles yet?Â  Donâ€™t worry!Â  Keep a look out on theÂ InstagramÂ for an update on the next antique candle restock!

Â 

Want to learn more about Laura or Erica? Â Check outÂ The Turquoise HomeÂ andÂ Our Humble NestÂ on Instagram!

Â 

Â 

Â 

Photography by Laura fromÂ The Turquoise Home, Erica fromÂ Our Humble Nest, andÂ HJ Creative Photography

entry.title: why we use soy wax
entry.content:
Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â (previously Antique Candle Works)Â isÂ a small businessÂ that puts great care into the products we send out to our friends all across the nation.Â  We pay attention to every single detail in order to provide you with the best candle experience possible, right down to the ingredients used to actually make the candles. All of our candles use fine fragrance oils, cotton wicks, and 100% soy wax.Â 

Â 

We are often asked, "what are the benefits of a soy candle?"Â Brittany (CEO + founder) chose soy for Antique CandleÂ Co.Â® for three specific reasons! Here are some of theÂ amazing reasons whyÂ soy wax candlesÂ are the best!

1. Itâ€™s natural and local.

Â 

Our soy wax is made from soy beans that are domestically grown right here in the United States.Â  The soy bean oil that forms the wax is eco-friendly, renewable, naturally biodegradable, and water solubleâ€”which makes itÂ easier to clean,Â too!Â  Unlike the paraffin wax that many candles are commonly made of (which often comes from foreign petroleum oil), soy wax is non-toxic and supports American farmers.

Â 2.Â Your candle will last longer.

Soy wax has a low melting point, so the wax doesnâ€™t get as hot.Â  This slower burn will allow you to enjoy your soy candle 30-50% longer than other candles.Â  Also, because of this lower melting point, there will be more liquid wax around the wick itself.Â  This allows the fragrance oils to evaporate into the air more efficiently, filling your home with a strong, lastingÂ scent.

Â 3.Â It allows for a cleaner burn.

Not only does this mean your soy candle will produce very little black soot or smoke like paraffin candles, thus not discoloring your furniture and walls, but this also means soy wax produces a clean burn.Â  Because soy is a natural source, is does not increase the level of CO2 in the air.Â  There are also no carcinogens or pollutants.Â  Compared to paraffin, soy wax is much safer and healthier for your family, pets, and the environment.

Soy wax was an obvious choice for Antique Candle Co.Â®.Â  As a small business, we support local, natural, and safe resources.Â  We care about every person who uses ourÂ candlesÂ and using soy wax is just one way we make sure to give you the best candle experience possible!

Are soy wax candles your favorite type of candles to burn in your home? Â Let us knowÂ what you think of the benefits of soy!Â 

Have an empty candle jar? Check out our blogs on how toÂ repurpose these beauties! ğŸ’•

Â 

Have a beautiful day!

entry.title: how to create the perfect candle setting: Simple Cozy Charm
entry.content:
As you may know, here at Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â (previously Antique Candle Works)Â we strive to achieve that popular farmhouse look in ourÂ Mason jarÂ and antique candles.Â  Itâ€™s a style that is pure and simpleâ€”just like us.Â  I recently connected with our friend Martha from theÂ Simple Cozy CharmÂ blog who also adores farmhouse design and shares an appreciation for our soy candles!

For Martha, it all started a couple years ago when her oldest of three daughters went off to college.Â  With a husband who travels for a living and the realization that in a few years they would be â€˜empty nesters,â€™ she was concerned about how to handle this new transition.Â  So, she decided to focus on her love of decorating and push forward in hopes of â€œfinding a new beginning.â€

Her home is evidence that farmhouse style came naturally to Martha.Â  With early roots on a farm and a house on a quiet lake, the country life is home!

I feel like many of us can relate to one of Marthaâ€™s favorite aspects of decorating: shopping!Â  I know I always love browsing the home goods section!Â  She also loves that a big part of interior design is change.Â  She can create an entirely new space by simply rearranging the furniture and dÃ©cor she already has!Â  There is always something new and creative that can be added to a room.

OnÂ Instagram, Martha shares a whole gallery of photos of her beautiful home.Â  We adore all of her pictures, and we love seeing how she styles Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â candles in her home! â€œCandles mean COZY!â€Â  They create an atmosphere of warmth and romance, which can add a whole other level of homeyness to any room!

To Martha, the perfect candle setting means a grouping of three.Â  Three different items, including a candle, that complement one another within the room.Â 

She enjoys combining fresh flowers, an old book, and a good candle (like an Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â candle!).Â  No matter how she designs a candle setting, it always creates a happy atmosphere in every room.Â 

Her favorite room to decorate with candles, however, is the kitchen!Â  With the classic Mason jars that hold our candles and some of Marthaâ€™s favorite scents such asÂ Clean Cotton,Â Mommaâ€™s Kitchen, andÂ Pumpkin Spice, the kitchen is the perfect place for an extra touch of farmhouse flare!

Visit Marthaâ€™sÂ blogÂ for some excellent reading on home dÃ©cor and stop by herÂ InstagramÂ for a gallery of gorgeous home photos!Â  Stay up to date with Simple Cozy Charm onÂ Facebook!Â  I hope Marthaâ€™s insight on decorating helps you to create your very own, perfect candle setting with your favorite Antique CandleÂ Co.Â®Â candle!

This article is second in the series of, "How to Create the Perfect Candle Setting." Â Has Martha's advice inspired you? Â Let us know!

Â 

Have a beautiful day!

Â 

Â 

Â 

Photography by Martha Knake
